title: Redwood National and State Parks: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial Events at Redwood           Beachfront Celebration: Find Your Park! Saturday, September 3rd-Sunday, September 4th. Crescent City, Del Norte County. CA. You are all invited to an ocean-side block party held over Labor Day Weekend. Have fun and enjoy all the different recreational opportunities that are found in Del Norte county. There will be BBQs, paddle-boards, different events, vendors, movies, live music, art in parks, kids games, bike rentals, games, ranger-led activities, brew-fest, story-corps and so much more. More information...       Centennial Celebration in the Redwoods. Sunday, June 26th, 2016. Bald Hills Road north of Orick, California Everyone is invited to a free celebration of the National Park Service's 100th anniversary featuring activities for all ages, including wheelchair accessible horse-drawn carriage rides provided by Access Adventures, Michael Muir’s non-profit organization that connects people with disabilities with nature through the horses. There will also be shuttles to nearby trails, live music, and food vendors. More information...     The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Redwood National and State Parks is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Circle of Discovery  Circle of Discovery parks of northern California and southern Oregon include Redwood National and State Parks, Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve, Crater Lake National Park, Lava Beds National Monument, Tule Lake Unit, Lassen Volcanic National Park, and Whiskeytown National Recreation Area. Read more   Find Your World Heritage Sites in the United States  The World of World Heritage awaits. Get out and explore the 22 World Heritage Sites in the United States and see what makes these protected areas unique. Find out why the World has recognized them as being the most significant cultural and natural sites on the planet. Read more      Call to Action Projects    Learn more about the work we're doing to prepare for the future.
